column4: I realize Breezy is just a preview right now but they need to have serious hardware support right out of the box
If not it will go by the way of BeOs
I still use Be and like it,
I also like this Breezy but I see little difference between the two except for GUI
I am going to update be back later
Helo all. Are ther any defrag utilities for breezy or linux that will work on breezy?
The only os I know of that didn't fragment was BeOs
Be Os fragmented so little that it was barely visible
I wish I could afford to upgrade
silliness aside, it depends on the apps you need to use to be productive
my wife is a linguist and she will only use linux
so did you have a problem with ubuntu someone could help you with ?
first thing, have you done a search on the ubuntuforums and google ?
I think this thread will sort you out. http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=25151
